pdhp216:1: Many people shaken by fear go for refuge
pdhp216:2: to mountains and woods, to places with beautiful trees.
pdhp217:1: That is not a secure refuge, that is not the refuge supreme,
pdhp217:2: nor is it the refuge to come to that liberates from all suffering.
pdhp218:1: Whoever has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Dhamma and the Saṅgha,
pdhp218:2: and who sees as it really is the four noble truths.
pdhp219:1: That is a secure refuge, that is the refuge supreme,
pdhp219:2: that is the refuge to come to that liberates from all suffering.
pdhp220:1: If, when cows are crossing a road, their leader goes crookedly,
pdhp220:2: they all will go crookedly, as their guide crookedly does go.
pdhp221:1: So it is with humans, he who is agreed upon as chief,
pdhp221:2: if he lives unrighteously, so will other people.
pdhp222:1: If, when cows are crossing a road, their leader goes straight,
pdhp222:2: they all will go straight, as their guide straight does go;
pdhp223:1: so it is with humans, he who is agreed upon as chief,
pdhp223:2: if he lives righteously, so will other people.
pdhp224:1: One should live by Dhamma, with good conduct, not with bad conduct,
pdhp224:2: living by Dhamma one lives at ease in this world and the next.
pdhp225:1: One should live by Dhamma, with good conduct, not with bad conduct,
pdhp225:2: living the holy life one lives at ease in this world and the next.
pdhp226:1: The one who finds pleasure in the Dhamma, delights in Dhamma, reflects on Dhamma,
pdhp226:2: the monastic who remembers Dhamma, does not abandon the Dhamma.
pdhp227:1: The Dhamma protects the one who lives by the Dhamma, the Dhamma well-practised is set on happiness,
pdhp227:2: this is the advantage of the Dhamma well-practised, he who lives by the Dhamma does not go to a bad destination.
pdhp228:1: The Dhamma protects the one who lives by the holy life, the Dhamma well-practised is set on happiness,
pdhp228:2: this is the advantage of the Dhamma well-practised, he who lives the holy life does not go to a bad destination.
pdhp229:1: Not having lived the holy life, not having gained wealth in their youth,
pdhp229:2: they waste away like herons in a small lake devoid of fish.
pdhp230:1: Not having lived the holy life, not having gained wealth in their youth,
pdhp230:2: they lie like shafts scattered from a bow, wailing about things in the past.
pdhp231:1: The mindful ones who are striving do not delight in a dwelling,
pdhp231:2: like geese who abandon a lake, they abandon fondness for homes.
pdhp232:1: As geese go through the path of the sky, they go through the sky by their power,
pdhp232:2: the wise are led out in the world, after crushing Māra and his army.
pdhp233:1: Why this laughter, why this joy, when the world is constantly burning,
pdhp233:2: when thrown into darkness, do you not seek for a light?
pdhp234:1: As a town in the border districts is guarded on the inside and the outside,
pdhp234:2: so one should protect oneself, and you should not let the moment pass,
pdhp234:3: for when the chance has passed they grieve when consigned to the underworld.
pdhp235:1: Not through being shaven is one an ascetic, if one lacks vows, speaks lies,
pdhp235:2: and is endowed with greed and desire, how will one be an ascetic?
pdhp236:1: The one who quenches wicked deeds, small and great, in every way—
pdhp236:2: through the appeasing of wicked deeds he is said to be an ascetic.
pdhp237:1: For the one in whom thirty-six streams consisting of contact with conceit are strong,
pdhp237:2: the one with wrong view is carried off by the flow of his greedy intentions.
pdhp238:1: One should abandon anger, one should abandon conceit, one should overcome every fetter,
pdhp238:2: without clinging to mind and bodily form, sufferings never do befall the one having no possessions.
